resource.http://dev.llgc.org.uk/sas/full_text: Inclusion of the character <span id="docs-internal-guid-50dd785b-7fff-de2e-2e88-11ba67ba4838" style="font-size: 11pt; font-family: Arial,sans-serif; color: #000000; background-color: transparent; font-weight: 400; font-style: normal; font-variant: normal; text-decoration: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap;">የ at the end of Ge'ez nouns typically indicates personal possestion. In this case, "my heart".
resource.chars: Inclusion of the character የ at the end of Ge'ez nouns typically indicates personal possestion. In this case, "my heart".

item.value: <svg xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg'><path xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" d="M3417.62985,2614.4583h293.48563v0h293.48563v112.4231v112.4231h-293.48563h-293.48563v-112.4231z" data-paper-data="{"strokeWidth":1,"rotation":0,"deleteIcon":null,"rotationIcon":null,"group":null,"editable":true,"annotation":null}" id="rectangle_7049c9dd-00b4-459e-bac7-8f83cef86c20" fill-opacity="0" fill="#00bfff" fill-rule="nonzero" stroke="#00bfff" stroke-width="1" stroke-linecap="butt" stroke-linejoin="miter" stroke-miterlimit="10" stroke-dasharray="" stroke-dashoffset="0" font-family="none" font-weight="none" font-size="none" text-anchor="none" style="mix-blend-mode: normal"/></svg>

resource.http://dev.llgc.org.uk/sas/full_text: Inclusion of the Ge'ez character <span id="docs-internal-guid-d9a4a4c3-7fff-f9d1-8aeb-11d38e5bb3d0" style="font-size: 11pt; font-family: Arial,sans-serif; color: #000000; background-color: transparent; font-weight: 400; font-style: normal; font-variant: normal; text-decoration: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap;">ወ at the beginning of words is often used in place of the word "and". In this case, "and son".
resource.chars: Inclusion of the Ge'ez character ወ at the beginning of words is often used in place of the word "and". In this case, "and son".

resource.http://dev.llgc.org.uk/sas/full_text: Damage to the parchment resulting in missing text and breakage of material. Damage may be attributed to wear along the binding and general age and condition of the parchment
resource.chars: Damage to the parchment resulting in missing text and breakage of material. Damage may be attributed to wear along the binding and general age and condition of the parchment

resource.chars: Spot of discoloration which obstructs the text in this area. This may be due to ink bleeding or possibly natural discoloration of the parchment.

resource.chars: Descriptive label written in English. Label says, "DEP 5861", likely marking some organizational information. Unclear if this mark is related to the Princeton stamp.

resource.http://dev.llgc.org.uk/sas/full_text: Stamp of ownership from Princeton University Libraries. Stamp is physically marked on the parchment as opposed to a digital watermark.
resource.chars: Stamp of ownership from Princeton University Libraries. Stamp is physically marked on the parchment as opposed to a digital watermark.

resource.http://dev.llgc.org.uk/sas/full_text: Paper stamp added to the parchment with both English and Ge'ez text. May signify past ownership or organizational use.
resource.chars: Paper stamp added to the parchment with both English and Ge'ez text. May signify past ownership or organizational use.
